definition: lit. pulling on the lapels exposes the elbows (idiom)/strapped for cash/unable to make ends meet
to clutch/to grab/to capture
lapel/overlap of Chinese gown/fig. bosom (the seat of emotions)/to cherish (ambition, desires, honorable intentions etc) in one's bosom
to appear/also written 現|现[xian4]
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
elbow/pork shoulder

sentences.english: With the depression of twe industry, the expenses of hotels or restaurants are beside their benefits.
sentences.chinese: 隨着旅業界的不景氣，賓館和飯店也開端捉襟見肘。

sentences.english: The relegation of France from top table to scullery would be an historic post-war shift.
sentences.chinese: 法國從桌上上賓到捉襟見肘是戰後一個歷史性的轉變。

sentences.english: These resources were already stretched thin by the new reality of financial austerity.
sentences.chinese: 這些資源在財政緊縮的新現實面前已經捉襟見肘。

sentences.english: So we became a single parent family and money got really tight.
sentences.chinese: 於是我們家成了一個單親家庭，日子過得捉襟見肘。

sentences.english: Following the recession of tourism industry, hotels and restraunts also face the crisis.
sentences.chinese: 隨着旅遊業的不景氣，賓館和飯店也開始捉襟見肘。

definition: to come apart
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
lit. a cup of water on a burning cart of firewood (idiom); fig. an utterly inadequate measure
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
circumstances
comfortable niche
to raise a loan/to borrow money
dangerous/ruthless/treacherous
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to rely on/to be dependent on
to raise (money)
lit. before it rains, bind around with silk (idiom, from Book of Songs 詩經|诗经); fig. to plan ahead/to prepare for a rainy day
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
